abstract: Obama administration, in unprecedented move, agrees to allow Indiana Gov Mike Pence to expand Medicaid in state to include mandate of monthly premiums for those above poverty level of 2 percent of their household incomes; additional 350,000 residents will be covered under plan, which also features penalties for non-payment.
lead_paragraph: After a lengthy back-and-forth, the Obama administration has agreed to let Gov. Mike Pence of Indiana, a Republican, expand Medicaid on his own terms, including some that have not been allowed before under federal rules.
snippet: After a lengthy back-and-forth, the Obama administration has agreed to let Gov. Mike Pence of Indiana, a Republican, expand Medicaid on his own terms, including some that have not been allowed before under federal rules.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: Indiana Will Allow Entry to Medicaid for a Price
headline.print_headline: Indiana Will Allow Entry to Medicaid for a Price
